SEARCH
Package org.abstractica.javacsg

Interface JavaCSG

public interface JavaCSG
Provides a comprehensive set of immutable geometric modeling operations for both 2D and 3D.

This interface includes methods for:

  • Creating and manipulating Angle, Vector2D, Vector3D, and polar coordinates.
  • Constructing and transforming 2D and 3D Geometry2D and Geometry3D objects.
  • Performing Boolean operations (union, intersection, difference), hull, and Minkowski operations on geometries.
  • Extruding 2D geometries into 3D, slicing 3D geometries, and converting between 2D and 3D.
  • Creating and applying transformations via Transform2D and Transform3D.
  • Loading and saving 3D models in STL format.
  • Viewing and caching geometries for analysis or inspection.
All methods return new immutable values and never modify their input arguments. Use these methods to build, transform, and combine geometries for modeling, visualization, and computational geometry tasks.

  • Method Details

    • rotations

      Angle rotations(double rotations)
      Creates a new Angle specified as a fraction of a full rotation.

      Use this to define angles by how many full turns they represent.

      Parameters:
      rotations - the angle in full rotations (1.0 = 360Â°)
      Returns:
      a new Angle representing the given number of rotations

    • degrees

      Angle degrees(double degrees)
      Creates a new Angle measured in degrees.
      Parameters:
      degrees - the angle in degrees
      Returns:
      a new Angle representing the given degrees

    • radians

      Angle radians(double radians)
      Creates a new Angle measured in radians.
      Parameters:
      radians - the angle in radians
      Returns:
      a new Angle representing the given radians

    • vector2D

      Vector2D vector2D(double x, double y)
      Creates a new Vector2D with the specified coordinates.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate
      y - the y-coordinate
      Returns:
      a new Vector2D

    • sqrLength

      double sqrLength(Vector2D vector)
      Computes the squared length of the given 2D vector.

      Use this to avoid unnecessary square root operations when comparing lengths.

      Parameters:
      vector - the Vector2D whose squared length is desired
      Returns:
      the squared length of the vector

    • length

      double length(Vector2D vector)

      Parameters:
      vector - the Vector2D to measure
      Returns:
      the length of the vector

      Parameters:
      vector - the Vector2D to convert
      Returns:

    • asVector2D

      Vector2D asVector2D(Polar2D polar)
      Converts a polar coordinate to a 2D vector.
      Parameters:
      polar - the Polar2D to convert
      Returns:
      a new Vector2D representing the polar coordinate in Cartesian form

    • polygon2D

      Geometry2D polygon2D(Iterable<Vector2D> vertices)

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      a new Geometry2D polygon

    • polygon2D

      Geometry2D polygon2D(Iterable<Vector2D> vertices, Iterable<? extends Iterable<Integer>> paths)
      Creates a 2D polygon with possibly multiple paths or holes.
      Parameters:
      vertices - an Iterable of Vector2D defining all polygon vertices
      paths - an Iterable of paths, each path is an Iterable of vertex indices
      Returns:
      a new Geometry2D polygon

    • identity2D

      Transform2D identity2D()
      Returns the identity 2D transformation.
      Returns:
      a new identity Transform2D

    • compose2D

      Transform2D compose2D(List<Transform2D> transforms)
      Composes multiple 2D transformations into one.

      The transformations are applied in the order of matrix multiplikation. The list of {T1, T2, T3} is equivalent to T1 * T2 * T3.

      Parameters:
      transforms - a list of Transform2D
      Returns:
      a new composed Transform2D

    • compose2D

      Transform2D compose2D(Transform2D... transforms)
      Composes multiple 2D transformations into one.

      The transformations are applied in the order of matrix multiplikation. The array of [T1, T2, T3] is equivalent to T1 * T2 * T3.

      Parameters:
      transforms - an array of Transform2D
      Returns:
      a new composed Transform2D

    • compose3D

      Transform3D compose3D(List<Transform3D> transforms)
      Composes multiple 3D transformations into one.

      The transformations are applied in the order of matrix multiplikation. The list of {T1, T2, T3} is equivalent to T1 * T2 * T3.

      Parameters:
      transforms - a list of Transform3D
      Returns:
      a new composed Transform3D

    • compose3D

      Transform3D compose3D(Transform3D... transforms)
      Composes multiple 3D transformations into one.

      The transformations are applied in the order of matrix multiplikation. The array of [T1, T2, T3] is equivalent to T1 * T2 * T3.

      Parameters:
      transforms - an array of Transform3D
      Returns:
      a new composed Transform3D

      geometries - an Iterable of Geometry3D
      Returns:
      a new Geometry3D representing the hull

      smallCircleDiameter - the diameter of the small cross-sectional circle
      largeCircleDiameter - the diameter of the large ring
      smallCircleResolution - the resolution of the small circle
      largeCircleResolution - the resolution of the large circle
      centerZ - if true, centers the torus along the Z-axis

      a new Geometry3D torus

    • loadSTL

      Geometry3D loadSTL(String fileName) throws IOException
      Loads a 3D geometry from an STL file.
      Parameters:
      fileName - the path to the STL file
      Returns:
      a new Geometry3D representing the loaded model
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the file

    • saveSTL

      Saves a 3D geometry to an STL file.
      Parameters:
      fileName - the path to the output STL file
      geometry - the Geometry3D to save
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while writing the file
